Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Service”
Reviews.Author: bandit1
Reviews.Content: Pre cruise spent 3 days at hotel; short ride to the port terminal. The location of the hotel is great-- walk to Gaudi apartments and La Ramplas. The service was excellent and the rooms were very well appointed with very large bathrooms and firm beds. The breakfast served affords everything you could desire in a fabulously decorated room-- if fact the whole hotel is beautiful as is the top floor terrace. Would recommend highly

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Wilacho T
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for five days and really enjoyed this place.The room was big, with a huge bathroom and a walk-in closet. The rooftop is very nice, but to be honest we were outside doing things most of the day so the hotel became the place just to sleep and then run to enjoy Barcelona. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: WilliamGodley
Reviews.Content: This fantastic hotel is exceptional in every way. The building is unique, the staff is outstanding, and the location couldn't be better. The place is pricey, but a stay at Casa Fuster is a unique experience. Some "standard doubles" are cramped since each room's layout is distinctive. Ask to see more than one room in the category you've booked when you arrive. I know Barcelona well--and have used a variety of hotels in that city--but have never enjoyed accommodations in Catalonia more.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Place in the heart of Barca”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: Casa Fuster was a great place to stay while attending Mobile World Congress. Location superb, friendly and helpful staff and very comfortable room. Que Magnifica!

Reviews.Title: “Unhelfpul staff”
Reviews.Author: james b
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel need to spend a few days at the Hotel Arts or the Mandarin in order to learn how to run a hotel and treat guests. There's no shortage of staff, but I've never experienced such negative, no-can-do attitudes in a 5* luxury hotel. It was almost as if some of them took a perverse pleasure in saying no. I look forward to the umpteenth change of management in recent years at this hotel. I suggest the owner brings in a professional operator.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: IvanL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on 18th February. On arrival the door staff took our car and baggage and we were directed to the reception where we met with extremely friendly staff. They gave us our keys and directed us to our room on the second floor. Opening the door, there was a really nice smell. The room was fitted with dark wood furniture with beautifully lit lamps and downlighters. The overall experience was of luxury and the bed and soft furnishings did not disappoint also. The bathroom was also very nice with spanish tiles floor to ceiling, piped music from the TV and good quality soaps and shampoos. The bar was really nice also with good food and drink. We ate quite late, at about 10pm and the staff were very pleasant and attentive. Breakfast was excellent with a really good choice of cooked items or pasteries. You could even have chocolate cake if you wanted. Overall a really nice stay and I wish it was for a few days longer.

Reviews.Title: “A few details away from 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Ejewett
Reviews.Content: The dining/bar are and breakfast area in the basement are beautiful with vaulted ceilings. The hotel has great service but missing a few details: 1) Wifi crawls to a stop due to more traffic than they have paid for bandwidth, 2) no irons in the rooms, which is not unusual for Spain and 3) no tea or coffee makers in the rooms. BTW, great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: perp1
Reviews.Content: The best stay you can have in Barcelona. I recomend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: stevenfromnyc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 7:30AM on a Saturday morning .. now, it depends on occupancy, but in this case our room was ready. We had booked a mini-suite and it was a really nice room - two balconies overlooking the Pasieg de Gracia, one of the main thorougfares. The room was all you would expect from a landmarked hotel - spacious, clean, a beautiful bathroom, robes, slippers, etc. The turndown at night could be requested anytime up to 10PM, so if you were in the room, just request they come back - yes, chocolates, but they would also lay your slippers by the side of the bed. The staff was very friendly and helpful - by the second day everyone greeted you by name. Don't miss the jazz evenings on Thursdays, various options for dinner, or drinks. The only negatives I can mention are 1) the carpet in front of our room was stained and should be replaced, it does not fit with the level of the hotel and 2) no newspaper in the morning - so, in short, it does not get much better. A special nod to Mark, service staff, and to Alexandra the concierge, though every one was superb!

Reviews.Title: “The place to be”
Reviews.Author: IoanaFI
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Casa Fuster for almost a week while i was away with business in Barcelona. And i would go there over and over again! It has the biggest rooms, with comfortable beds and huuuuuge bathrooms equiped with bith shower and jacuzzi. Actually it was the first time in a hotel where just the bathroom had three doors. Amazing, especially for women I suppose. The hotel has free internet with good connection and I personally had a great view over the boulevard directly from the work desk. If there's a downside of this hotel, that would be the receptionists which managed to mix up some of our passports and give them to the wrong persons in our group. Also, there were some money missing from the room of a colleague I was told. So, i'd double check stuff when it comes to security... I personally had a great experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Myron K
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in middle of Barcelona which was one of the only things I liked about the hotel. Room was ok but little problems with the room. Stupid things like not shelf in shower to put soap and shampoo. Also, didn't find the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Top class 5 star deluxe hotel in heart of Barcelona city center”
Reviews.Author: am001_10
Reviews.Content: We lucked out a great deal on LHW for this hotel. All round excellent staff at entrance, reception, checking, restaurant, housekeeping made us feel special. Complimentary chocolates and bottled water and wifi in room with lavish breakfast in restaurant , fabulous location on passé de gracia the equivalent of park ave in ny city, put this hotel on top of the best hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Casa Fuster”
Reviews.Author: Furman55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first night of our trip. Arrived early in the morning but he staff was attentive and helpful. Our rooms were ready and they took our bags up right away. The rooms were actually quite large and the shower in the bathroom is incredible. Beds were large and comfortable along with having a great balcony to walk out on. Go up to the 6th floor and there is rooftop with small pool and great views of the Passege de Gracia. Breakfast buffet in the morning was fantastic as well.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Artem T
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, especially lounge bar. It's very cozy. Service is very good: all my requests were satisfied. Rooms are quite good, but not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “An Example of Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: DavidFoodie
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hospitality. Great location, great property, great staff. Occasionally I write constructive criticism on other properties and i get replies asking me to describe what can be better. Now I know I just have to send them Hotel Casa Fuster to see first-hand what great looks like.

Reviews.Title: “In a single word... Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: MichaelKoch66
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy Barcelona, but this visit and hotel stay was exceptipnal. The hotel staff knew me by name, is courteous, and extremely helpful. My room had a balcony overlooking Paseo de Gracia, and was larger than most in Barcelona. Room costs were about average, but the service and location with relation to the main areas of the city was perfect. The bar downstairs is quiet and relaxing, and the service on time and non obtrusive. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Herb2Aud
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Casa Fuster before going on a cruise. The hotel is lovely, the rooms are nicely furnished and they had a wonderful buffet breakfast. We did not eat any dinners there, but did have some small tapas in the afternoon. The staff is very friendly, all speak English and are willing to assist with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Jazz Coffee Bar”
Reviews.Author: barcaranger
Reviews.Content: I paid 24.60 for two cups of tea and a cappacino while the staff rearranged the furniture in front of me Sat in what looked like very big comfy settee which turned out to be very musty This was 6pm the place was empty...................I can see why The rest of the place may well be lovely. It is in a great location but this was a real let down Took ages to find someone to pay

Reviews.Title: “A labor of love”
Reviews.Author: william p
Reviews.Content: The Casa Fuster was a labor of love,Mr. Fuster transformed a chocolate factory into this spectacular house for his wife. The hotel is in an ideal location and the décor is warm and welcoming. The attentive, friendly and professional staff could not have been better. Casa Fuster lived up to all expectations and more.

Reviews.Title: “THE elegant choice in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: wendyholm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my daughter. Wonderfully elegant modernist art deco hotel built in early 1900's. Beuatifully renovated. Very deluxe! Rooms are tastefully decorated and well appointed. Wonderfully attentive staff. Great location on Passeig de Gracia just blocks from las Ramblas and some of Gaudi's most important works... Member of Great Small Hotels of the World for good reason... :). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved to stay there”
Reviews.Author: marinoum
Reviews.Content: On the plus side : - when you arrive at the hotel, first impression is really good as the building is truly beautiful - rooms are small but cosy, we had one in a corner with a very small balcony and view over Barcelona, loved it - breakfast is amazing, that was our impression !! food everywhere, we could have stayed there for hours if we didn't have a plane to catch. We were lucky to have it on the first floor and not in the basement. - we had champagne offered because it was our honeymoon and greatly appreciated the gesture. On the minus side : - after arriving, no one helped us to carry our luggage...maybe because we are 25 years old and carry backpacks to travel ?! three different persons just looked at us (doorman, receptionist, butler) before realizing (after we said our name) that yes, we were clients and not people hanging around. - the swimming pool on the roof is very very tiny... Overall this was a very good stay but I think we won't stay there again, this is too posh for us :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful exterior, Good location, Room not good”
Reviews.Author: Solbaum
Reviews.Content: Beautiful exterior and Good location in center old town but room was large but had a central stand in the bathroom occupying most of the bathroom and could barely get around the central sinks' stand.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrandsk
Reviews.Content: This is a classic hotel, and in many ways it is superb. On the other hand, the rooms are relatively small for the price and it is a way off the main areas on the city.

Reviews.Title: “Ausgezeichnet!”
Reviews.Author: MG1313
Reviews.Content: Sehr schöne Einrichtung, gepflegtes Hotel, ausgezeichneter Service. Wunderschöne Lobby und hoteleigenes Café. Die Bar auf der Terasse bietet eine fantastische Aussicht, ist im Herbst (Oktober) leider aber erst ab dem späten Nachmittag geöffnet. Schönes Badezimmer, der Duschkopf könnte allerings wieder mal entkalkt werden.

Reviews.Title: “Great and classy place”
Reviews.Author: diaden2
Reviews.Content: We had absolutely delightful stay at Casa Fuster. We were there for a special celebration and we were surprised with a bottle of champagne and cake in our room on arrival. Loved the breakfast buffet. Champagne at breakfast buffet with fresh figs and fresh strawberries is a classy touch. The room was real nice and with very luxurious bathroom. Yolanda at the desk was very helpful in sending us the some real good restaurants. It is expensive , but is worth it. My wife and I enjoyed our stay very much and would love to return sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Casa Fuster in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Doodles_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Casa Fuster in August and it's taken me a while to write this so apologies! Our stay was wonderful and the only thing to fault is the price of drinks in the hotel - extremely expensive. Some people have commented that it is dark inside and seen this as a negative - the way I would describe it is boutique a hotel with calm ambience and sometimes the muted tones were a pleasant contrast to the brilliant sun outside! The staff are superb, extremely helpful, well mannered and quick to help you with any query. When we arrived, they knew we were on honeymoon and immediately briefed us on places to visit, best ways to travel and how to get there. Our room was not quite ready but our bags were taken care of straight away and we were free to sit on the roof terrace or go off and explore. Our room was lovely, number 207 which overlooked the street but was by no means noisy. Great a/c, lovely jacuzzi bath (but don't overfill or doesn't work - safety feature we discovered) spacious and immaculate. There were lovely added extras in the bathroom and on our first night we received a complimentary bottle of champagne and hand made chocolates to celebrate our recent wedding - nice touch. Barcelona is amazing, I'm not big on cities but it was chic but friendly. The tapas bars are fantastic and the sights all around to see. I'd reccommend the hop on and off tour buses that run on the red, blue and green routes, you just get on and off as you wish and they run every 2 or 3 minutes it seemed. Even in hot August, we rarely had to wait more than 10 minutes at the most because it was so busy. Make sure that you visit the Sagrada Familia and try to go in, it's worth it. My other half also loved Camp Nou but it's not cheap! Parc Guell is lovely but a steep climb so not the best in boiling hot weather and the Olympic Stadium is worth a visit. We had no problems going down Las Ramblas with regards to pick pocketing but just take care and be sure to visit the Boqueria - it's the food market and great to wander around. Anyway, if you are going to Barcelona, be sure to check out Cataluna restaurant and stay at Casa Fuster, I would not hestitate to do so again. Thanks you to them and their staff. Doodles x

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: gailbrown100
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night break in the Casa Fuster. Outstanding hotel but very pricey - 25euro for a bacardi and coke! I know this is a 5* LG but come on that's excessive, although Barcelona is a very expensive place to visit we found All the staff were fantastic during our stay and nothing was to much trouble for them, extremely helpful and imformative. Excellent buffet breakfast Good location

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in spain”
Reviews.Author: hilltopper1614
Reviews.Content: We stayed in all 4 or 5 star hotels throughout Spain last week and this was without a doubt the very best. The whole hotel staff from front desk, bell staff and housekeeping seemed to have one goal- customer satisfaction. They could not be more accomodating. Very professional yet at the same time more than willing to go out of their way. We checked out and were headed to another beach town, when the staff heard this, they recommended that they hold our bags so we wouldnt be troubled bringing them, then offered for us to use their spa when we returned so we could shower and clean up before continuing our trip to Madrid. Great location, but I must say that the staff really made our stay at Casa Fuster very nice. I thought the rooms were very nice, not the largest , but clean and well thought out. Great bathroom. Overall I was very impressed and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: coughy
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, certainly not five star by USA standards, but very comfortable. The staff was most helpful and always very nice. Good location. The rooftop bar was great with a beautiful view. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building, hotel a little lacking for a 5*.”
Reviews.Author: SuZeeDee
Reviews.Content: My stay here was due to a wedding that I was attending at this hotel. When we arrived, the check in wasn't as smooth as it should have been, in my opinion. We arrived in the afternoon - about 14.30ish, and were told that our room wasn't ready yet. Ok, no big deal, and we were asked to wait 10 minutes, and we'd be checked in while we waited. However, after doing all the check in business, and then waiting for about 15 mins, I was approached by another member of staff asking me for my passport and credit card. Again. I explained that this was already done, but for some reason it wasn't done properly and all had to be done again. Very annoying for a 5* premises to not be able to check you in properly first go. The room was nicely decorated, but our view was of an adjacent building, so the curtains remained closed throughout our 2-day visit. The room was very nicely decorated, but quite small - although probably not smaller than you'd expect for a lot of city-centre hotels. Now, I tend to hold any hotel claiming a 5* status to a very high standard, and I must say that the hotel room - for this reason - wasn't as clean as I might have liked it. Overall, it was good, and the bathroom was scrupulously clean, however there was an ipod-dock/radio provided in the vanity area [which I really liked!] but it looked like it had NEVER been dusted. There was a thick layer of dust along the radio, behind it, and along the back of the vanity area, under the information books. Not good enough for a 5* in my opinion. Also, the cables at the back of the tv were very visible and leading down to one of those connection and power hole-thingies in the floor. However, due to the tangle of cables, the cover couldn't be put back properly over the hole in the floor and the overall result was that it looked really messy. Personally, I didn't like the layout of the bathroom - that it's more part of the room than a separate room of its own [it just has a frosted glass sliding door to separate] - it felt like it lacked a bit of the privacy one likes in a bathroom - and the shower practically flooded the whole area the first time I turned it on. Tip to the staff - if you know that the shower will flood the bathroom if the shower head is left pointing towards the shower doors [as opposed to the wall], then don't leave the shower-head that way for your guests to use! Breakfast was as you'd expect. Nothing really good or really bad - although it wasn't until we had gotten to the room that I'd realised that despite TWO check-ins, neither receptionist had told us when and where breakfast was served. Again, not good enough for 5* service. The roof terrace is lovely, and has a beautiful view down along the avenue to the ocean, but if you're expecting to be able to swim in the pool - don't. It's more of a leg dipper than a pool - I'd guess it only measures about 4m by 2m. Plus, the one morning we did decide to spend by the pool, we had to go find our own towels and cushions for the sunbeds as [even though it was after 10am, nothing had been laid out up there yet]. Overall, I think it lacked a bit of what you expect when you pay for a 5*. I probably wouldn't be bothered staying here again on my next trip to Barcelona - but I will say that they did a great job on the wedding I attended: the service and the food were excellent. It's unfortunate that this didn't spill over into the other areas and services provided by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel in Chic Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: mervenadir
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptionally helpful, especially the reception. Also,the staff at the front door also ensured that the taxis knew where we wanted to go and were always there to assist us. The neighborhood is excellent and pleasant to walk around and not so touristy and crowded. The lobby area could be better; more amenities, better decor. Rooms were nice, very clean, contemporary and well sized. great bathrooms with awesome amenities! also the pool area at the roof adds a great bonus to your visit. Would consider staying here again and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Cool boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMon
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Casa Fuster, great location, amazing building, great service. They set up our limo's, tours, restaurant recommendations, etc. and everything went famously. Our junior suite had an amazing view but limited closet space, and the decor was nice and modern with a spacious, elegant bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed by this 5*”
Reviews.Author: Danielle M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was highly recommended to my boyfriend and I by his father who stays there regularly. We found a very good deal on a online booking website and were excited to stay at this luxury hotel. When we first arrived it was quite early in the morning and our room was not available – the hotel clerk explained that he would send us an SMS as soon as the room was ready, by 6pm no SMS. We got to our ‘Superior Room’ and right away noticed a thick coating of dusk on every surface, as well as broken drawers in the dresser that were sticking right out into the room, as well as a blood stain or something of that nature on the lamp, not a great first impression. We also noticed that the shower leaked onto the floor when the water was turned on, making it a bit treacherous. We did however, comment on the fact that it was not a king bed as requested but two twin beds, the gentleman that brought our bags said that he would have housekeeping make the bed into 1, which was done for us right away. We found some of the front desk staff to be extremely nice and accommodating but did have a bad experience with one gentleman who seemed to not care that we were spending money at his place of employ. Not impressed. We asked for the best route to the beach and were barked at by him and told to take a certain line of the metro. We tried to find that line at the closest station but realized that it was quite a trek and were better off to take the bus (buy your ticket at a station – 2 days for 11 Euro instead of 17 at the tourist centre). The pool was also ridiculous – any smaller and it would be a puddle. The second day of our stay we returned in the evening to change for dinner and noticed that our room was open, we brought this to the attention of the front desk and they did not seem to be too worried about it. I am thankful that nothing was missing as I don’t believe the hotel would have been too helpful in replacing any missing items. We were extremely unimpressed by the hotel, perhaps it was due to us booking on a discount website? If so, then the hotel should remove itself from that service so that no other tourists have to deal with this problem. I doubt we will return, and my boyfriend’s father has also decided to no longer stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nakny
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we were highly disappointed by Casa Fuster. Especially if high quality service is what you expect from a 5 star. We were coming with my girlfriend from real 5 stars from Prague (the Four seasons) and from Venice (the Bauer) so the contrast was deeper. We had a second reservation at Casa Fuster and we cancelled and book another hotel. Examples of what happened: a) attitude at the reception desk while they couldn't find our reservation (it was there); b) we asked for a queen/king bed and we got doubles (later they did united them, but very unprofessional w/ covers below the bed sheets, that obviously the wrinkle below your back); c) took 10 minutes for the operator to take our call from the room (didn't apologize and when asked she mentioned she has "only one line") d) the hotel computers don't have Microsoft word; e) concierge service is almost non existent, didn't know much. about the restaurants we asked, btw: all of them very well known; e) the gym is a joke. In general I don't write reviews though I spent 50 / of my time in hotels, unless they are very good or very bad. The latter, unfortunately, was the case.

Reviews.Title: “A suprise”
Reviews.Author: Roozel
Reviews.Content: The Casa Fuster is a quaint old building with great modern faciities. Staff were excellent, welcoming and genuinely warm in their hospitality. My room was spacious, clean, well appointed and quiet even though it faced the street. The rooftop bar has great views but the drinks selection is pretty limited. I would return on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic, Historic, Centrally-Located , Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJLaB
Reviews.Content: As the title of this review suggests, this great little hotel is all that and more! Upon arriving in Barcelona (from the political demonstrations in Athens), the Casa Fuster Hotel provided a very favorable respite for our first trip to Spain. The lovely tree-lined boulevards and charming cafes provided a wonderful environment for pleasant strolls to museums, restaurants, and even live Flamenco dance performances, as well as a splendid marina area--and, of course the works of Antonio Gaudi! When I made the reservation, the hotel staff asked if this might be a special occasion. When I replied that we were (quietly and privately) celebrating our 44th Anniversary, we were greeted with chilled champagne and chocolates in our beautiful, balconied room. The entire hotel staff was welcoming, friendly, efficient, and very professional. The young woman concierge was particularly helpful, and quite knowledgeable. (Her name escapes me at present, but she is British, born in Spain.) A perfectly pleasant place to stay which includes all the conveniences of the present combined with a glimpse of the rich cultural past of a splendid cosmopolitan city. we will definitely stay at the Casa Fuster Hotel whenever we return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: KdJd2006
Reviews.Content: Last night of our 2 week trip before returning to the U.S. and we had such a great time. The hotel is beautiful, old school stylish and very elegant. The service was outstanding and our room was fantastic. They sent us up the street for dinner at a wonderful restaurant that was our best meal of the trip. The location is great as it is a very nice area of Barcelona - not as busy as some of the areas but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagochica801
Reviews.Content: Casa Fuster is a great hotel, and I am surprised it was so affordable. It is in a good location near Gracia neighborhood and everything you need to get to you can walk. The hotel has a tiny pool on the roof with an amazing view, but drink are super pricey. The breakfast in the morning is a huge buffet of any food you can think of. The staff was always polite and helpful. Our room was clean. The only reason I marked it lower was because it maybe could have used new carpet. The fitness center was only one treadmill. It would be best to get out and run the hills of Barcelona anyway! We also found a great restaurant near the hotel that was cheap and amazing called Catalana on 236 Mallorca. We went repeatedly for the food and drinks. I definitely reccommend Casa Fuster.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and special luxury hotel with a few odd kinks”
Reviews.Author: theluxuriant
Reviews.Content: Casa Fuster is really a gorgeous luxury hotel with good service and all the amenities that are usually expected for this kind of hotel. The facade is amazing, it used to be a family home and the interiors are very well decorated, kind of modern, classic and decadent Barcelona style at the same time. My room was small but cozy and well appointed with a fantastic carrara marble bathroom with a tub and a bidet (kudos for the bidet!) and great lighting. The closets are spacious so you will find ample room for shoes and dresses. There are a few reasons why I didn't give them five starts instead of four: 1. They do not have a very disciplined cleaning methodology. This is strange: the carpeting in my room was stained and looked pretty tired, it needed a major clean with strong white spirit. When I first arrived there was an open pack of crisps on the dressing table. I put on my bathrobe which looked impeccable and discovered a pair of pearl earrings in the pockets. Those pockets are not protected so I was baffled to think how a bathrobe that had undergone the strain of machine wash could keep a pair of earrings safely. 2. A very strange cleaning lady: Our cleaning lady came in to open the beds in the evening while my mother and I were naked in the bathroom getting ready. The music in our room was booming so it was evident the room was occupied. She came in without asking whether she could come in or not and proceeded to open the beds. This was such an imposition, they should try and come in when people are not naked and strolling around. I wonder whether Straus-Kahn's cleaning lady was as impertinent. 3. Their pillows are a disaster. You will notice that I am very picky with pillows. These were too big and uncomfortable. I called to get a pillow menu and the guy forgot my request. Casa Fuster is a five star hotel GL (grand luxury) so I find it very strange that they have polyester filling in their pillows instead of down. 4. I ordered room service (huevos estrellados with chips), but they weren't real huevos estrellados. This happens to me a lot in great hotels, their cuisine just isn't as good as what you can get out there at an average restaurant. I have to say that the food was beautifully presented over starched cotton carpets though. All in all great value five star hotel, but they should work a bit harder to keep the GL status, as it is really a gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimstravels
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay in Barcelona. We stopped at the Casa Fuster and could not really fault the hotel or service. the only downside was the cost of drinks etc.(approx. £7 for a small beer £11 for gin ,tonic ) The hotel has a small rooftop pool and good size terrace which was really welcome after a day of sight-seeing and a nice way to unwind before going out in the evening to sample some of the great cuisine.,The staff were extremely courteous and made some great tapas bar ,restaurant recommendations The hotel is located in a very pleasant part of the city.There are plenty of cafes etc. near to the hotel for breakfast coffee etc.,The hotel supplies all toiletries hairdryer after shave toothbushes razor etc. in the room.Barcelona is a fantastic city to visit for a short break.Strongly recommend using the tourist buses (30 Euros for two days) You can see the whole of the city.they run every few minutes and you can hop on and off them whenever you want covering all the key points of iterest. Warning; If you visit Los Ramblas area avoid anyone offering you the chance to gamble ,play games such as guess where the dice is under match boxes etc.. these are organised criminals and they WILL rob youWe saw it happen on more than one occasion . All in all a lovely hotel ,great staff just over-priced drinks etc.take the edge of what was a very enjoyable experience Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “More like two stars”
Reviews.Author: William60713
Reviews.Content: The location, if you want to be in the heart of the shopping district, is excellent. Can be a bit noisy given proximity to high vehicular and pedestrian traffic. Value wise, there are better accommodations and services offered elsewhere and for the same rates as the Casa Fuster. The room at the Casa Fuster was unclean. Besides the furniture being dust laden throughout my stay, the carpet had dark maroon and black spill stains ( ranging from the size of a serving plate to the diameter of drink coasters) throughout the room which appeared to have never been cleaned. I noticed cookie crumbs in the main hallway right outside my room that had been overlooked by housekeeping for the two days (originally planned to stay at the Fuster for five days). The staff at the reception desk opted to be pompous in favor of being hospitable. Perhaps they were earnestly trying to exude a feeling of exclusivity. In my opinion, that type of behavior doesn't work and should not exist in any establishment, especially one that offers nothing more than a two star accommodation and a one star housekeeping service. Other than that, I cannot find any fault in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: MikeGW
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel. Promised much but delivered little. Rooms small, dark and "fusty". First room had water leaking through the roof. I was moved immediately, but no apology, porter took a tip and new room just as disappointing. The carpets are dirty and the wallpaper peeling. Definatley needs an upgrade. Roof top terrace was nice, but no service until 4pm and pool was in reality a glorified bathtub (so small). Bteakfast average, but in general not worth the 300 euros charged for the night. Barcelona has much better, cleaner and less expensive hotels and I would certainly not return to the Casa Fuster.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel , good location”
Reviews.Author: sui106
Reviews.Content: A beautiful modernistic house at the end of Paseo de Gracia. Confortable rooms, good service. We enjoyed to stay there in a weekend

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, expensive drinks and food (EUR 9 for a small coke, EUR 36 for two Gin and Tonics)”
Reviews.Author: Hicksonnator
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a 5 night mini-moon (a quick honeymoon ahead of a trip later in the year). We saved 40% on the standard rate by booking via booking.com, paying EUR 1700 for 5 nights including breakfast. We arrived at 9am and the hotel found us a room immediatley which was very useful. Our room was on the firsy floor facing the street and was very noisy. The hotel quickly upgraded us to a room facing the courtyard on the second floor. I wouldn't recommend a street facing room on the first floor. The staff were excellent, the room was very nice and the hotel manager sent us a bottle of Champagne. My only comment was that the cost of additional items like room service and drinks at the pool was ridiculously high. Coke is more expenisve than beer at EUR 9 for a small bottle, while gin and tonic at the roof top bar (a wonderful, underused location) was a whopping EUR 36! For a great hotel, not too far from the Ramblas (about a 10 minute walk) with a wonderful pool and roof terrace you could do no better.

Reviews.Title: “Extended visit before staying at the Hotel Arts”
Reviews.Author: JohnK15
Reviews.Content: Center of everything, Top of Las Ramblas. First class

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Great location, amazing staff, simply the best”
Reviews.Author: manu070
Reviews.Content: Casa Fuster, well, where to begin with? The location is just perfect in, Passeig de Gracia, 2 blocks from the Casa Batló, great restaurants and stores. Delicious breakfast. The staff makes sure everything goes great and the rooms are just beautiful and comfortable. One of the best hotels I´ve ever stayed in. Perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Spanish Palace”
Reviews.Author: cthompson65
Reviews.Content: Me my wife and a friend we spent 4 nights at Casa Fuster in Barcelona. I strongly recomend it is very well located at Barcelona's main street, near the main shops, restaurants and atractions. The rooms are nice and the place is quie, the staff is always ready to help you. The breakfast we had at nearby cafes. The penthouse where the bar and the pool are located is a must go place.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS WE HAVE STAYED IN - AN ABSOLUTE GEM!”
Reviews.Author: Chantellebreeves
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on this site, I was quite nervous about this hotel, but from the moment we stepped into the magnificant foyer, we were treated like royalty in this amazing hotel. There are so many good things I want to say, I'm not sure where to start. Check In - We arrived at the hotel mid morning and didn't expect our room to be ready. we just wanted to drop our case off, but following a very friendly and smooth check-in we were told our room would be ready in 5 minutes and in about 3 minutes we were handed the key. We stayed in room 501 and it didn't disappoint. The room was ample size, spotless and the icing on the cake was a direct view of Sagrada Familia from our large window. The bed was HUGE. Beautiful quality furniture with Gaudi influence, luxurious velvet drapes and a large luxury bathroom with power shower and large bath. We had two sets of bath robes and slippers in our room and a lovely seating area too. There was ambient lighting, air conditioning and a lovely library filled with beautiful books on Barcelona. The hotel provided us with complimentary maps and a tour guide. We booked the tour bus tickets at the recpetion desk and also booked into the hotel restaurant for Sun eve. The hotel restaurant is fine dining and was quite expensive but after a tiring day sightseeing it was nice to only have to get the lift back to our room. Breakfast was fantastic. The dining room was in the basement with a wonderful large vaulted ceiling and ambient lighting. The staff were extremely efficient and provided fresh coffee and warm milk. The buffet breakfast had everything you might possibly want, including champagne and strawberries! There were lots of pastries and warm food as well as home made smoothies. We asked the staff if they could recommend a good tapas restaurant nearby for the second evening. They gave us a choice of three, marked them on the map and told us to check them out when we were out during the day, let them know our favourite and they would make a reservation for us. The restaurant we chose was just a couple of blocks away from the hotel and was absolutely superb - fresh tapas in a contemporary setting and lively atmosphere. Location - once again, I cannot fault the hotel. We loved the central location. In a very upmarket and safe part of the city. It was very quiet in the evenings and we were glad to be away from a lot of the busy hustle and bustle but still in the heart of the city. A must - check out the pool and bar area on the hotel roof. The views of the city from the top were breathtaking! To sum up, I really cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. All the staff, without exception were so helpful and friendly. We are very well travelled and have stayed in 5 star hotels all over the world. This is one of the best and we will certainly return with our family next time.

Reviews.Title: “Could be Great IF ONLY...”
Reviews.Author: Italian_in_Boston
Reviews.Content: This would be a wonderful hotel IF ONLY… Let’s start by saying that the Fuster is hosted in a beautiful signature building from early 1900s and its location is wonderful, at the end of Paseo de Gracia. Rooms could be better but overall are OK. I stayed in two superior rooms; the first one was #115, facing a secondary alley and with very little natural light; the second one was #207, with great views on the Paseo de Gracia. However, the windows in the latter were not very high quality, so there was quite a bit of noise during the night. In both rooms temperature control was not too reliable and the showers were rather cheap (bad shower heads; also, water temperature was randomly changing). However, overall they were OK room. The problem is service and maintenance, as it looks like the whole staff at the Fuster is stoned! Here are some examples: I wanted to book a restaurant and had to ask three times as everyone kept on forgetting it. I asked for my room to be made up and it took six hours (!) before something happened despite a very visible sign on the door. Once I arrived at the hotel in the late afternoon and I had to wait a lot before being able to get my room key (the front desk is understaffed and they were busy with someone else – but you cannot wait that long just to get your room’s key!). When I moved to room #207 I gave up on using room service altogether – not last because the phone in the room was out of service! In short, 5 start building and location but run like a 1 star… PS: forgot to mention that Internet was terrible, running on and off (because of a DNS problem I think)...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to enjoy all of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Seacoast3
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for the Barcelona marathon and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Casa Fuster. The hotel is ideally situated at the northern end of the shopping district so it is convenient yet not in the middle of the busy plazas. We loved that it was two short blocks to the nearest metro stop and we purchased a 3 day metro pass and rode it to the sights all over the city. Our hotel room was on the fourth floor and included all the helpful amenities. It wasn't a large room but it was perfect for the little time that we spent in our room. We also enjoyed the lovely piano music in the lobby bar and even went up on the roof to enjoy a few quiet moments above the city streets. Wonderful view! Two mornings, we enjoyed breakfast in the cellar restaurant and service was quite good. I would agree with the reviews that mention that the carpets are a bit tired and that you can occasionally hear the subway which runs under the hotel but iti is a city hotel. Yet for first time travelers to Barcelona, I would recommend Casa Fuster since it is such a beautiful hotel with an excellent staff and is so ideally localed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous -- as good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: Janet9988
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some gorgeous hotels -- for example, the Rsmbagh Palace in Jaipur (also a Leading Hotels of the World, which seem to be great). The Casa Fuster is at the very top of my list. When can one stay in a great modernist palace, in rooms with velvet chaises, in a decor of purple, magenta, and gold colors, everything five-star and, to our amazement, affordable. Granted we were here off-season, but everyone on the staff was very accommodating, especially the manager who gave us a great price on a room. Going to the Cafe Vienna on a jazz night is very special; the jazz is top level. The view from the roof terrace is magnificent. The sheets, pillows, amenities. . . swoonable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LizzieW63
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at hotel Casa Fuster for 2 days in February 2011. We were greeted by the staff and given a host of information of where to go in Barcelona. The room was a available and we checked in straight away. We had a basic room - but we were still very impressed. The breakfast was an excellent buffet choice. The bar prices were a little pricey - but we did go to some bars in the city where they charged more. Overall we enjoyed out stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Historic Mansion, Needs Maintenance & TLC”
Reviews.Author: atraveljunky
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Hotel Casa Fuster. We chose this hotel over the Mandaring Oriental as it is an historic building in Barcelona, designed by one of the great turn-of-the-century architects. It's in a great location (a littel out of the hub bub of the city, but still very accessible), has a great lobby/bar (although even having a water or cup of tea there is incredibly expensive) and a professional staff. My husband and I stayed in a junior suite for 5 nights (room 211 to be exact). When we checked in to our room we were please with the size and amenities. However, the carpet needs a good shampoo and the furniture is already damaged (gouged, dinged, etc). I guess we're pretty picky about that kind of stuff, but it just makes me think they are not keeping up with maintenance. Also, FYI - despite the fact that we were on the 3rd floor (2nd in Spain the way they figure what floor you're on) we felt and heard the subway going under the hotel (our room in particular) - something that's not the fault of the hotel; It's a busy place with meetings and such going on there almost every day/evening. I hope the management sees the importance of keeping the place up as overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissatisfied - Not Even Close to a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lanz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Casa Fuster hotel on a pre cruise stay at 10:30 am on October 21. I emailed the hotel that we would be arriving early and were celebrating my husband's retirement and my birthday. After traveling for more than 24 hours we were very grateful the desk manager gave us a room, 304, unfortunately as we entered the room we heard very loud construction, jack hammers and a large crane pile driving outside of our room. We had a construction site right outside our room with no chance of getting any rest. My husband immediately went back to the desk and requested another room, he was told that they could accommodate us at 4:00 and suggested we ride the HOHO tourist bus until that time. We took his suggestion) even though it was cold and rainy and we were exhausted. We returned at 3:30 and were told that the room was still not ready, we were shown alternate rooms by a very nice bellman and he suggested we get something to eat and return at 5:00 when one of the rooms would be ready. We left and went to the hotel recommended tapas bar and returned at 5:00, we were told by the front desk that a room was still not available. At that time we had been awake for more than 30 hours, we told the desk staff that there was no way we could wait for another room, we were not treated with respect, and this was definitely not the service or accommodation that was expected from a five star hotel. I don't think there was ever a room available for us, and sending us off several times was disrespectful and humiliating , we were offered no apology and no solution. At 7:00 am the next morning the construction began again, thank goodness we left on a tour shortly after. The key to the room never worked and someone had to let us in several times, I have a feeling this room wasn't used in a long time. The room was obviously in need of renovation as the carpet in the entry way had holes and was very worn and stained. The bathroom had rust around the tub area, definitely not the standards of a "five star hotel". To sum it up, my husband and I are retired professionals; we have stayed in many five star hotels for business and leisure. It is hard to believe that a hotel with this reputation could treat clients with such disrespect and offer a substandard room that no one could have slept in due to the construction noise. Construction happens, but the real issue is the way we were treated, telling us to come back in six hours, than two hours and then again and still not finding a solution. We never heard from the desk or management again, no one apologized or attempted to relocate us. Casa Fuster is definitely NOT a five star hotel, and the rate we paid which included a substandard breakfast was incongruous.

Reviews.Title: “A true leading hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights together with my family and we had a true pleasant stay. I have stayed at several “The Leading Hotels of the World” and the Casa Fuster was in no way disappointing and offered even a very reasonable price compare to other full-service hotels in Barcelona and Europe. I would definitely stay here again, even if it should be nice to try the Mandarin Oriental. I like this place, because it’s both luxurious and modern in a conservative way. The room is comfy, with all amenities you may need and every night we got complimentary water and the excellent chocolate of Enric Rovira (every time I go to Barcelona I visit his shop, in an odd location at Josep Tarradelias 113, but it is a most). The bathrooms are beautiful, luxerious and with an freshness as it was new, even if the hotel is some years old. They provide both morning coats and bathrobes. All over the place there are several things that remember you about the city and the “modernista style.” My family was impressed when I visit Gaudi’s museum that several things of his works actually is in the hotel (I knew it before my reservation), so it’s a great hotel for people that never before visit Barcelona and will use some hours to enjoy the art work of Gaudi and then get a dejavu at their place to stay. The location is perfect, in a nice and quiet area even if you are in the absolute city center. Several good restaurants and bars around the corner, we had a wonderful dinner at the Moo Restaurant. We never had dinner at the hotel, the restaurant was looking a little bit desolated. Bar Viene is a perfect spot and great service. Breakfast is great and I was impressed how much the staff to attention to details and recognize my request of fried eggs each morning. Things I would recommend them to do are to get the bell boys up to speed and a deep-cleaning of the carpets in the rooms. They are a little bit shabby and I was happy that the room was provided with slippers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShuggieO
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to this Hotel for a 3 night short break for her 40th Birthday. The greeting we had on arrival was fantasic, they made you feel really special and were most helpful. The porter showed us around our room which at first I thought was a little on the small side. We did book a double room but ended up with a twin although the beds are pushed together to form in essence a double. If it is a double you require this might be worth checking before you depart. I wasn't overly fussed about this. The Hotel is located a good 20 to 25 minute walk from what I would call the centre of town and is an easy walk. If this is too far for you I would suggest looking at other hotels. We drank in the hotel bar once and had a beer, brandy coffee and 2 brandy's and got hit for 52 euro, but then it is a 5* Hotel what more would you expect. Overall a lovely hotel and location, staff are fantastic, breakfast was great, rooms a little on the small side but otherwise everything you would expect from a 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: edithTheHagueHolland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Casa Fuster hotel for one week in september and were very content on the level of service and the warm smile of the staff. It was raining cats and dogs during 6 days of our stay so we spent quite a lot of time in our junior suite wich was really spacious and decorated in a way that we felt at home. The difference in price between a standard room and a junior suite is not too big and very much worth to pay. Standard rooms are small and look out over the roofs of Barcelona and many building places. The junior suites overlook the Passeig de Gracia in its complete glory and the view is, even when it's raining, marvellous! The swimmingpool on the topterrace does not deserve the name "pool", it is very small but you find nice beds and chairs to take a sunbath and the bar on the terrace is a lovely place to spent your evening after a long day of sightseeing. Prices of food and drinks are high (11 euros for a glas of wine) but quality and service is in relation to the price! The only minor point of the hotel is that breakfast is served in the basement without any windows. A hotel that I would really recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: allanwexler27
Reviews.Content: This hotel, beautifully decorated, lies in a posh area of Barcelona, an easy walk to much of the cities top sites. The rooms were quite nice, although the absence of a clock or a radio was a surprise. You could access a radio on the television at a small charge. Staff were very courteous, always with a smile, and eager to assist. The breakfast was terrific and the jazz night at the hotel was highly entertaining. I always felt comfortabler coming back to the hotel at night, to chocolates and water. Free internet in the lobby was a bonus. A first rate facility.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff and a beautiful building”
Reviews.Author: Irishguest
Reviews.Content: The architecture and location are excellent; it is a really beautiful building with wonderful views down the Passeig de Gracia. The roof terrace provides a specatular 360 degree vista of the city but the pool is just for paddling; the water is not much more than knee high. For me, the staff, the setting and the architecture are what mark this hotel out. We found the reception staff to be exceptional; they booked us into really great restaurants and were at all times genuinely friendly and helpful. I was not so keen on our room; the layout was very awkard and the noise of the traffic from outside was very marked (but earplugs took care of that). I have to say that I found breakfast to be a rather dismal and depressing experience. It is served in a windowless basement room and the food on the buffet table looked as though it had been put out the evening before. On the one occasion we ate there, the cheese and cold meat slices had hardened almost to a crisp. We found it so offputting that we did not eat there again even though it was included in our rate. You can get a really good breakfast at Farggi just on the other side of the Diagonal at the corner of Corsega - for about 20 euro for two.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: nbk5276
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona on October 1st after a 2 week cruise through the mediterranean. We arrived pretty early in the morning and were immediately met by the doorman who promptly whisked our luggage away. We knew that we would not be able to check in as it was around 9 am. The hotel is not in the super touristy area of Las Ramblas, which was nice. After 2 weeks of dealing with crowds it was nice to get away from the crowds. The hotel is located on the passage das Gracias a main street which runs through Barcelona. We had plans for the bulk of the day so not checking in upon arrival was not a big deal to us. The hotel is in a renovated Modernista mansion which has been very thoughtfully turned into a hotel. When we came back later in the afternoon, we were able to get our rooms, which turned out to be very nicely laid out. The bathroom in our room has to be the best bathroom I have ever had in a hotel. Nice walk in shower with a rain faucet and the car wash faucets on the walls. It was quite luxurious. The beds were comfortable, and the other amenities in the room were better than expected. The main reason I did not give this hotel a 5 star rating is, on our second day we had been out and about all day and upon returning to the room at 4 pm the room had still not been serviced by housekeeping. The staff were very welcoming and accomodating and eager to help out in any which way possible. I would definitely stay here again on a return visit to the lovely city of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “delightful hotel in a period building in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: throppy
Reviews.Content: This was my thrid trip to Barcelona, and I wanted to stay somewhere special... So I booked Hotel Casa Fuster... First impressions were very good. The hotel is set in a stunning building that locals refer to as a monument, positioned at the top of the Passeig de Gracia with great views down toward Plaça Catalunya and La Rambla, and ideally located amongst the masses of Modernisme buildings including Antoni Gaudi's most memorable designs - just 5 mins from Casa Batllo, Casa Mila (also known as La Pedrera) amongst others. The staff were very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Our room, although small, was nicely formed, and decorated to a high standard, using opulent fabrics, and expensive furniture. However, the room we had wasn't in the old part of the building, so we had views of a brick wall and an alleyway at the rear, and there were some things that were a little shoddy - a cigarette burn on the carpet, and on a piece of furniture, the shower spewed water all over the bathroom floor, the shower screen was glass and had too big chips on either side with exposed sharp bits. The television services were astronomical, as indeed was any food not included... and the food which was included, in our case, the breakfast, wasn't of sufficient quality to warrant the money! Forgetting price, and some minor issues with the room, it was a lovely hotel where we were made to feel at home. The staff were wonderful, and I guess that the good stuff outweighs the bad enough for me to be able to recommend it. The best part about it is it's proximity to great tapas bars and the major sights of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: CharbKM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The concierge was so helpful, my friend's luggage had been lost and they helped us locate it. They had great recommendations for where to go out in Barcelona and how to best see the sites. My only regret is that I didn't stay longer! Breakfast was delicious, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Undoubted luxury but falls a bit short”
Reviews.Author: Roly100
Reviews.Content: At this level (I think they are rated 5* grand luxe or something similarly exalted!) you expect excellence of the very highest order and they deliver on this very well in many ways: A building of significant architectural importance, beautifully appointed rooms, a knockout roof terrace with sweeping views right down the Passeig de Gracia, some wonderful modern design features, a great location, friendly staff etc. When I say they fall a bit short, this has to be taken in the context of where they are aiming (and charging!). The bits they don't quite get right are (i) service - it was all very well meaning and friendly, but it didn't have that layer of refined professionalism that you expect at this level (ii) as they are in a protected building, there are some odd twists and turns in the building and in the rooms e.g. the entrance foyer is comparatively small and underwhelming (iii) the food in the restaurant whilst beautifully presented and served, was not up to much - too much style over substance (iv) the hotel was almost empty when we were there so the atmosphere felt a bit chilly..... that's often the case in places like this, but it was noticeable here. This quibbles did not spoil our stay in any sense, but on balance I think I would probably spend my money elsewhere the next time. Casa Fuster is still a very special hotel and has enough wow factors for most people but if you are expecting the best of the very best I think they fall short.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect Barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: gigglesmildred
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend break in Barcelona. Have spent many years taking weekend breaks across Europe, reviewing each hotel in detail on trip advisor and then returning home never to write a review on the hotel just visited. Well its time for that to stop. Having visited Casa Fuster on the weekend I just had to say what a fab hotel. If your looking for a boutique, luxury, historical hotel with all the mod cons look no further. From the moment we arrived Marc on the reception desk was a pleasure to deal with, got stuck right in from the outset to help us get the most out of our weekend. We arrived very early and no problem our room was ready. We got to the room and were delighted with the style, size of the room, sitting room and bathroom, just as the hotel assistant was leaving the room, a loud cango hammer began some drilling outside, he immediately asked if this was a problem, to which we replied yes and within minutes we were taken to alternative, quieter and equally fab room. It started off well from there and kept going, the staff, the room, the linen, the bathroom, the roof top sun lounging area, bar and pool (small) and the location (I didn;t step inside the gym!) the hotel and the staff made our weekend. The breakfast and bar food was great, didn't stop for dinner so have no comment to make. So if your not on a budget break to barcelona and want to treat yourself a little - go on you deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Casa Fuster”
Reviews.Author: SnKColorado
Reviews.Content: 1. Arrival experience: knew we were early so they advised room would be ready by 3pm "guaranteed". Returned after sightseeing, beautiful city, hot and tired at 4:15pm and were told room not ready yet. Okay but it would have gone a long way if the person at reception pretended to care. NOT! Didn't even offer to buy us water while we waited. We were told another 30 mins so after about 40 min my husband had to go to the desk and ask (yes, that is correct they did not come to us) if our room was ready. Luckily it was. 2. Room nice and clean. Has the energy efficient system that not only shuts off the lights when you leave but also the air conditioning. Not good when it is very hot and humid. 3. Breakfast - we were told buffet breakfast available and you can have via room service. Well yes and no. Our room service person literally told me "that it was only continental (we did request eggs) and it wasn't his problem". Next morning we went down to the breakfast and what so you know it is a buffet breakfast with hot items like eggs and sausage bacon... 4. Did send an email to the customer relations manager advising of our displeasure letting her know we were currently in the hotel (opportunity) and have never heard back. 5. Of course at check out we had to fight regarding the breakfast. Oh and by the way they wanted to charge us another 48euros to have eggs and fruit! 6. Fitness room was on the top level....hotter than Hades!! 7. No value received! We will never recommend!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Pure Luxury, comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: kidfree
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was our last stop on a 4 city trip around Spain. I wanted to pick something extra special to end the trip in style. Casa Fuster did not disappoint! It is a magnificent property. The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly. We were upgraded from a standard to a superior room with a view directly over the Passeig de Gracia. The room was large, clean and expertly decorated. The bathroom was awesome! The amenities were above and beyond with his and her special kits in addition to wonderful shampoo, conditioners, bath gel, body milk etc. We loved the location. We were in the poshest part of town which meant that there were not necessarily eating bargains right there. But we did have some wonderful meals in restaurants we found in Maribels guide and that were suggested by the hotel staff. It was quiet and much more civilized than being on the Ramblas. We were able to walk to Plaza Catalunya in about 10 or 15 minutes. While this was not a "bargain" like some of our other hotels. We truly felt like we got an exceptional experience at this hotel that was priceless. The pool on the roof is small but delightful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and I have already recommended it to friends traveling next month

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel, good location, beautiful historic building”
Reviews.Author: PabloMun
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in a recent business trip to Barcelona, the room is very good, mine had very interesting books of the region. Only down side was that my room´s window was next to a school and you could hear noice in the room since early morning. But I would recomend the Hotel 100%

Reviews.Title: “Casa Fuster is service personified”
Reviews.Author: aleida1004
Reviews.Content: Casa Fuster is not a historical site but an excellent hotel. It is in the perfect location for visiting Barcelona. We parked the car at Casa Fuster and traveled by foot, cab, and bus everywhere we needed to. Most of the sites were within walking distance. The staff at Casa Fuster was wonderful. They spoke several languages and were able to make excellent recommendations with respect to restaurants and sites. The rooms were not just clean; they were immaculate and spa like. The service was excellent at Casa Fuster.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned but charmingly so”
Reviews.Author: marianhwang
Reviews.Content: Pulling up to the hotel, we thought the architecture was classically Barcelona. Inside the service was terrific especially when we asked about the air conditioning in our room not working. It was fixed straight away. For Barcelona, the bar prices were pretty high but drinks on the roof are worth it. The pool is very small but it is on the roof. I would say if you like a more modern hotel, spend a few more bucks and go the Mandarin Oriental but if you want to stay in a historic building, this is a good choice. Pros - great service, comfortable, good location Cons - breakfast is ridiculously priced, small pool

Reviews.Title: “When in Barcelona............”
Reviews.Author: crawfie
Reviews.Content: Casa Fuster is special. The building is an architectural gem, at the top of one of the most prestigeous streets of Barcelona, yet only 3 minutes walk from real life Barcelona in the Gracia district. The reception staff and front of house could not be more helpful, and the rooftop staff are very good. The only blemish on a great hotel are the staff in the ground floor lounge (a superb room) who seem to be only interested in serving those who will give them the largest tip! Some serious retraining required here! The standard rooms face the back, but are quiet and have a view of Sagrada Famillia over the rooftops. The baths could be better designed as you have to be an olympic gymnast to get in and out'... not for the faint hearted. The standard of the rooms are excellent. There is a small gym on the roof, and although the pool is an oversized plunge pool, it serves that purpose when the mercury rises over 30. The weekly jaz club is a bonus, and well worth the visit. If in Barcelona.... it is worth pushing the boat out for this.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: newlyweds69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights of our honeymoon after a week trip in Tenerife. This hotel is beautiful. From the moment we stepped out of the taxi to the time we checked out. Service was impeccable, We had a junior suite, with a balcony overlooking the main street Paseo de Gràcia. Very central to everything. We did the bus turistic (hop on hop off bus tour) and we were not too far from Casa Mila. Upon our arrival, we were greeted with a bottle of champagne and pastries . The rooftop patio is beautiful, pool is small, but we were so busy walking along the streets of Barcelona that we didn't have time to enjoy the pool. Drinks and food are expensive here, but the views are spectacular. We will definitely be back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: WendyB02
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at Hotel Casa Fuster and couldn't have been more pleased. The building is lovely, staff most gracious. The room rate was less than expected and included a very nice buffet breakfast. The hotel is a short walk from Gaudi's Casa Mila and Casa Batllo. First night turn-down included lovely tray of mini-pastries. Neighborhood great for walking with excellent restaurants within a 5 minute stroll.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel With A Crazy Charge For An Extra Bed”
Reviews.Author: Hampstead_Heath
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be extremely expensive. I saved a lot by booking through Booking.com rather than using the hotel's own web site. This put me in a good enough frame of mind to pay the crazy 128 Euros per night charge for an extra bed for our small daughter. This extra charge, more than many hotels charge for a whole room plus breakfast, didn't even include breakfast! The breakfast was expensive, good though not top rate. It suffers from being in the basement. This is an interesting Modernist room but it is still a basement and correspondingly gloomy. One day they had the breakfast on the ground floor because of some special event in the basement. This was far better, though the lovely head waiter still apologised that it wasn't sunny. The food is good but I've had better. The staff are terrifically keen and friendly. Some of them made a point of remembering my surname. There were plenty of friendly greetings. It was always easy to catch their attention if we required anything. But when I asked the concierge whether 9 year old children travel free on the Metro, he admitted he didn't know and guessed that they did. I think he should have gone and found out, particularly as his guess was wrong. Children over 4 have to cost the same as adults on the Metro. Our room had a lovely view down the Passeig de Gracia. This made a lot of difference to our enjoyment. I would say the hotel is well placed but a little out of things. Without the lovely view, we'd have felt a bit cut off. The bathroom was terrific: better than I've had in any other City hotel and only equalled by one or two country hotels with space to do something interesting. It was very big with a door to separate the bath and toilet from the rest, of required. The fittings were excellent and the design had successful Modernist touches. The bed was good. We didn't sleep too well though because the air conditioning was quite noisy and kept switching off and on in the night, waking us up. With the air conditioning off, the room became unpleasantly hot in the night even though the weather was cool. The interior decoration is a bit boring but luxurious and in very good condition. The building itself is a rightly celebrated example of Modernist architecture. The restaurant was almost empty on two out of the three evenings we went there. We had expensive but good meals each day and friendly converse with a waitress on the two quiet days. If these staff aren't genuinely pleased to see the guests then they certainly put on a remarkably good act! The restaurant is a fine room that they should consider shifting their breakfast to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice five star hotel....”
Reviews.Author: londongavin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights following a cruise which ended in Barcelona. We had transferred onto the cruise at quite short notice due to the volcanic ash, so we hadn't researched Barcelona hotels with the detail we normally would. I looked at the Mandarin Oriental, but the prices for the nights concerned were exorbitant, but then came across the Casa Fuster and decided to give it a go based on the reviews on tripadvisor. We went for one of the standard rooms given we didn't spend much time in the room. To be honest we were glad we hadnt paid 50% more for a higher grade of room as this was a decent size, very well furnished (contemporary but making use of classic features) and quiet. The bathroom was particularly good (although the shower always leaked over the floor). We didn't eat or drink in the hotel, but we thought the front desk and concierge service was excellent. We were allowed to check in when we arrived at 10am and the concierge made some excellent recommendations for dinner and gave us some other helpful advice. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel for a relaxing city break in a not too stuffy five star hotel. Yes it's a bit further up the hill than some of the other hotels, but we walked everywhere in Barcelona (including down to the beaches) from the hotel fine.

Reviews.Title: “Actually deserves it Grand Luxe rating”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: I visit Barcelona often and have stayed in many of the good hotels there but this was rather special. At the very top of Paseo Gracia just around the corner from the bustling district of Gracia, this is a stunning hotel. We got a great deal and stayed in a junior suite with a great balcony and a view straight down the paseo. Great bed, bathroom and shower. The staff were delightful. We didn't eat in the restaurant (apart from breakfast, where, shockingly for Spain, they knew how to fry an egg) but am told it's very good. The bar is wonderful with live jazz on a thursday. The pool on the roof is very small, a plunge pool really, but there's lots of room to stretch out. There is a snack bar and gym also on the roof. Ca't recommend this hotel enough, it really is rather special.

Reviews.Title: “right place, right location”
Reviews.Author: BasherWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Casa Fuster is a small 5* hotel close to a number of the gaudi designed houses and only about 300 yards from La Pedrera. The hotel is also only 300 yards from the tourist bus stop for both loops, one covering the 'Gaudi' tour and the other Montjuic and the seafront. The rooms we were given were spacious, clean and full of the luxuries you would expect. There was a very comprehensive turn down service and the reception staff and conciege were extremely friendly and helpful. If you can get a deal, I would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but way over priced. Careful with the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Maast
Reviews.Content: I had to stay for business. I picked it 'cause it was one Leading Hotel of the World, which got me a view upgrade thanks to my status. Nice view then but the hotel is not outstanding in any way. Service is not very helpful. Hotel has a nice exterior but is lacking some charm and the price is super high. Stay away from the in-room breakfast: it cost me more then 60 euros because they counted every single request as an extra with a crazily expensive price list. Overall, the prices at this place are not reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DEBUOSHOU
Reviews.Content: We, including a kindergartener, stayed there for 3 nights during Christmas Holidays 2009. Now I believe the ranking of this hotel in TripAdvisor is much under evaluated. Never miss this 5 star grand-monument hotel engineered by Lluis Domenech i Montaner famed for Palau de la Musica Catalana & Hospital de la Santa Creude Sant Pau. The renovated interior of the hotel was very cool and worth paying the money for their service & hospitality. The staff were all kind enough to us. They really know how to accommodate their guest. Please note that their breakfast at decorative -1 floor was so tasty. Never forget to go up to the roof. You can take a view of Mediterranean Sea and El Temple de la Sagrada Familia because the hotel is located at the top of Passeig de Gracia!! Major Metro station is about 3 min. walk from the hotel. Very convenient to go everywhere. I visited a chapel just behind the hotel on Dec 24 midnight. Many locals got together and I could listen to hymn tune outside (because I am Buddhist). We found a good restaurant near the hotel named "Shojiro" (Ros de Olano, 11 Tel [--]), just 5 min. walk from the hotel, which serves Mediterranean dishes and run by Japanese. It was so nice. I will never fail to stay here again when I return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: IslandsR4Me
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Casa Fuster in early October. Check-in was a breeze and we were quickly escorted to our junior suite. The room was incredibly spacious with a large sitting/living area separated from the bedroom by french doors. The bathroom was also very large with a separate shower, bathtub and two sinks. Our room had two balconies - one in the living area and the other in the bedroom - that overlooked the Passeig De Gràcia, but the room was surprisingly quiet. The hotel staff, including the front desk, porters, room service and doormen, were all friendly and very helpful. The hotel is centrally located and we found it very easy to get around Barcelona. We did not eat in the hotel's restaurant, but did order room service which was good, not great. I would recommend this hotel to people who are looking for an elegant experience in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and not 5* qualities”
Reviews.Author: CheekyUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Casa Fuster late October 2009 as a 40th birthday celebration. This being our first time abroad without our two young children we decided to stay in a 5* hotel and treat ourselves but this is not a 5* hotel in the true meaning of 5*. The hotel is located about 20 minute walk to The Ramblas and is at the top of the ‘posh shops’ parade so not quite as central as some but certainly easy to walk to main locations from. The building itself is architecturally beautiful. We had a standard room and didn’t get a room with a view (we’d booked through Monarch and got a good rate so maybe this was why). The room (416) was very small and very dark- adequate but small, and certainly not 5*. Bathrooms are nice with huge, fluffy towels but the shower is over the bath and is extremely high to climb into. I couldn’t believe that for the price we’d paid there wasn’t any kettle or cups in the room – only refreshments were the expensive mini bar. The bar is lovely and the seating in the bar area palatial. The door staff, porters etc, were friendly and helpful. The rooftop pool hardly warrants being called a pool as I thought it was a water feature and certainly you couldn’t’ swim in it! It was unmanned at this time of year so you could only stand on the rooftop terrace and look down the Passeig de Gracia. As an aside, we had a lovely meal at Torres on Passeig de Gracia. Breakfast was not 5* really. Although there was something for everyone, including gluten free rice cakes, the English breakfast was awful. Scrambled egg that you could stand a spoon in and sausage on a bed of white beans! Have an omelette instead and wait 15 minutes is my recommendation! Sadly, this is not a 5 star hotel. The pool, fitness centre, sauna and rooftop bars are small and barely worth having. I would rate it a 4 star with some charm. I'm glad we visited Casa Fuster, but in future I think I’d save some money and stay in a 4* hotel. Barcelona was a great place and the hotel great to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Grand Luxe? Rooms with views only for "certain" people....”
Reviews.Author: nycinvestmentbanker
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and was given a room with no view, a dirty toilet, and the ability to hear a whisper in the hallway or adjoining restaurant. I was told this is one of the greats but it really isn't. We experienced the greatest bell staff ever - and this one gentleman made the entire stay for us. He is excellent, knowledgeable, and friendly However, he is the exception and not the rule. The rooftop is nice - just like any other hotel. The pool is too small to get into.
