The rooms are quite small and it seemed you had to be Spanish to get a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: playadeusgo
Reviews.Content: I had read previous reviews and was aware that a few people were less than complimentary about the hotel. However, on the recommendation of a friend from Barcelona, my husband and I spent 7 nights in Casa Fuster towards the end of Aug. We went there for a belated 25th wedding anniversary celebration. My Catalan friend who made the booking, made the reservations staff aware of the purpose of our trip and asked if they could make some small gesture for us. They agreed, but did absolutely nothing at all. Very poor PR on their part. The location is fantastic. The building itself is architectually striking. The bar is beautiful and the door staff, porters etc, were very friendly and helpful. We took a standard room and sadly, there was nothing five star about it. Such a disappointment. Very small. An attic room really. Very dated decor. Dark brown walls. Dark brown curtains. Badly stained floor carpet. Stained bed cover which I had to ask house-keeping to remove. The air-conditioning only worked whilst we were in the room. As soon as we left, it turned off because we had taken the key with us. With outside temperatures at 34 degrees, coming back to a small room that was like an oven, was unpleasant to say the least. The porter told us the alternative was just to leave the key in place and get reception to have someone open the door for us each time we wanted to return to the room! The bath tub/shower is potentially dangerous for anyone with a leg, hip or back complaint. So high that you literally have to climb in and out of it. Went into the bar on our first night and ordered two drinks - a Jameson Irish Whiskey with ice and a Havana Club rum with coke and we were charged €28.95!!! The same two drinks the next evening in a bar on Paseo de Gracia cost us €13! Roof top terrace prices were also very expensive. I'm glad we visited Casa Fuster once, but I wouldn't be in a rush to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: NOLAJC
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed one evening at Casa Fuster following a cruise. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly bell staff. Reception staff was cordial. I found it strange that the rooms do not have irons or ironing boards; there seems to be no guest laundry - so you have to send your cloths out overnight. Not good if you arrive and are expecting to press something and be at a reception or business meeting. Very unhelpful. I've never stayed in a hotel anywhere that didn't have iron/ironing boards or access to one. Found the hardware beautiful .. but things like the phone by the bed was not strudy and kept falling off the nightstand when used. The key to the door was very difficult to use at first. Surprisingly no one walked us to the room. Thought that was strange. Someone here said that Casa Fuster needs to decide what it's going to be and I agree .. they need to focus and refine their service levels and luxury status. Robes in the room - they had one men's room and then two tiny robes that I can only guess were for children or Asian clientele. But they did accommdoate and brought an additional robe. Nice roof top terrace ... pool is a joke .. it's about 10'x10'.... but pretty to look at. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service in a Beautiful Vintage Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lancew1219
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic, from the minute our taxi arrived. The doorman ran up and took our bags. Frank was inbcredible and gave us a beautiful room. We were treated within 15 minutes with some chocolate treats and sparkiling water. Everything we needed or asked for were taken care of. Great Location and Phenominal rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & Charming”
Reviews.Author: Kyozaan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the junior suite after getting a good deal through a friend & loved everything about Casa Fuster. From the spacious rooms to the eclectic ambience, the warm & hospitable staff as well as the ever helpful concierge. What more can anyone ask of a hotel? Have to add that this "leading hotels of the world" property is also perfectly located. This is where you need to stay when in Barcelona. Go for it my fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: nanicinema
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Anyone considering a trip to Barcelona should really think about staying in the L'Eixample area - I think that's what it is called! Its very beautiful with great cafes, shopping, restaurants, and Gaudi of course. The hotel looks great from the outside and the rooms do look good as well, but things don't always function. We had problems with the air conditioning in our room and after two nights the hotel did move us to a wonderful suite with great air conditioning but the shower wasn't very functional - water got everywhere and it was very slippery getting out of the bathtub/shower. It wouldn't have worked for anyone over 60. The staff was very friendly and did try to help us with any problems we had. We loved the location and Barcelona so much that despite things not always working (one of our TVs in the suite never worked) we still found the hotel charming. However we doubt we'll stay there again. The hotel needs to make up its mind what it wants to be. A five star boutique hotel or a trendy place. The roof disco was very pretty but the music didn't quite jive with the hotels image and patrons. It'll be interesting to see what happens to Casa Fuster in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I can see why Woody Allen liked it.”
Reviews.Author: harpbook
Reviews.Content: Let it be said that my initial impression of Casa Fuster was nothing short of revelatory. Maybe it's simply that Barcelona is the most magical city in Europe, but driving up Gracia in a taxi and seeing the building for the first time must rank as one of my favorite hotel arrivals of all time. My initial observations were overwhelmingly positive. The hotel lobby is beautiful, and I enjoyed bantering with the young receptionist who checked us in. First impressions of our junior suite were also great. The room had been renovated and had new wood floors (they were Pergo, actually, but not the smelly carpet mentioned in some reviews). The bathroom was huge and the walk in shower was elegantly designed. They had set up my daughter's bed in the living room. It was going very well indeed. We began to unpack, however, and immediately I noticed the room was a little warm. This was understandable as it was hot outside and you need to leave your key in the door to activate the electricity. I turned the AC to a low setting and popped open a celebratory water from the minibar. Then the phone rang. Apparently there was a problem with my credit card. I went downstairs and discovered that they had attempted to put a hold on my card for double the total of 5 days in a junior suite. The charge had been denied by Amex. I did think this was a little strange, but I gave them another card and went back upstairs to see how the room was cooling off. It wasn't. Now it was my turn to call. Apparently they were having problems with the hotel AC. Rest assured, they said, it would cool down in a couple of hours. We left to explore a little and find some tapas. The young receptionist, Borje I think, suggested a place up the street. We walked out of the hotel and it was obvious from just the first few minutes that Barcelona is an awesome town. The people are cool, the streets exciting and vibrant, and the suggested restaurant was filled with happy locales who were more than willing to translate the Catalan off the menu chalked above the bar. But when we got back to the room it was hotter. I called down again and heard what would become a familiar refrain. The building is old and charming. Don't worry, they said, it just takes time. Meanwhile they brought up a fan. Now this would have been a suitable solution if the fan had actually worked. Alas, it's oscillating function was kaput and we were forced to aim the air in one direction. Not a big problem, but we had two rooms. Oh well. (And the blackout curtain in the living room didn't fully close and had to be fastened shut with a safety pin to keep the street light from shining directly on my daughter's bed. She wound up sleeping with her mother anyway, so I was kept awake by heat and light. I lived.) I won't bore you with a longer narrative of the AC saga. Suffice it to say I spent several hours over three days trying to get it fixed. The technician came up at midnight on day two, got on a ladder, moved a ceiling partition, made some phantom adjustment and pronounced us good to go. Just wait a few hours, he said. At this point I knew every employee of the hotel and it was clear that the AC was permanently broken in our room, always had been, and that it would never be fixed. For over $500 a night this seemed a tad absurd. Why not just tell me the truth and move my room. Finally this is what happened. We were transfered one room over to a large suite with great AC and a sauna in the bathroom! Unfortunately the placement of the sauna had necessitated a smaller shower and bath combo with perhaps the least safe bathing entrance I have ever seen in a hotel. The edge of the bath was too high to climb in comfortably. Anyone with a knee injury, or maybe on the older side, or a child, would need help getting in and out. And the shower flooded the room... Again I could go on indefinitely with little problems and oddities. Both our rooms were nicely refurbished, but if you looked closely you could tell that the finishings were cheap and that corners had obviously been cut. Knobs fell off, the safe worked and then didn't, the TV failed, the internet cut out, and if you didn't leave your key in the room the electricity stayed off and the room was hot. So every time we returned a member of the staff had to accompany us. Despite all this I sort of loved the hotel. It smelled good. The rooftop was nice (pool is a joke, of course). The lobby cafe is stunning. The location is the best in Barcelona. Maybe if I had liked Barcelona less I would have been more aggravated by the comedy of errors that defined my stay at Casa Fuster. But the place is cool (in style, not temperature), and while I wouldn't stay there again, I'm glad I did once.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: guccilady
Reviews.Content: Great location excellent staff carpets a bit soiled and bath tub leaked but over all stay was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great roof top terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Euroshopper
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel is the rooftop terrace!! We seemed to have it to ourselves the entire stay. We would buy a bottle of wine then retire to the roof top and enjoy the beautiful view of the city. The staff were very helpful and all spoke english.. They brought several treats to the room. The day we arrived was my husbands birthday. The front desk took notice while reviewing the passports, and then delivered a bottle of champagne to our room. It was so thoughtful and we really appreciated their kindness.The halls are a bit dark and gloomy with too much carpet everywhere that smelled a little musty. The rooms are a bit worn with stains on the couch and carpet. . I would not pay the for the breakfast again- not worht it at all. It is a beautiful buiding from the outside, and is a historic monument.. Woody Allen stayed here while filming Vicki Christina Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: idletourist
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have pointed out - this is not a 5 star hotel. The pool, fitness centre, sauna and rooftop bars are token efforts. I would rate it a 4 star with some charm but sadly that charm was lacking during our visit. A major disappointment was that the Roof Bar was shut despite the great weather. This meant guests wishing to use the sun loungers or miniscule pool had to raid their mini-bars. There was no waiter service. The Fuster already has limited 5* facilities and to have one of the few they have unavailable is unacceptable in a true 5* establishment. Compare this to the Majestic Hotel just down the street where we also stayed this trip and which had a full menu and bar service around their (generally superior) rooftop pool. The AC in our room did not work. This is irksome in itself but what is unacceptable in this case is that we informed reception clearly explaining that it was NOT simply a case of the AC not having sufficient time to cool the room down as we had had it on all night. Despite this they appeared to have done nothing other than use our key (which was therefore not available to us when we returned from sightseeing for the day) to keep the room electrics on all day. Compare this to our stay in both the Majestic and a 3* hotel in Girona where the AC worked faultlessly. During our 4 night stay we had the turn-down service on 1 night. This despite the fact that we were absent from the room well before 8pm each evening. Not good - especially when compared to the Majestic who always turned down our bed. We also requested the conciege to purchase 2 tckets for a concert. He rang us 40 minutes later saying we would have to call at the theatre in person to get the tickets! Now we thought the whole point of a conciege was that they could do this sort of thing - and indeed this has been the case in London, Sienna, Budapest, Paris and many other places we have made such a request. Note it is not that they were NOT available - only that he could not apparently get them! This is unacceptable for a 5* city center hotel. As far as we are concerned he should have organised to have had them collected / delivered to the hotel for us. That would have been 5* service comnpatable to other european hotels. My partner and I also prebooked a 100Euro jazz dinner in the hotel on checking in so we would have an easy 1st night. This Jazz Evening was generally poor value both in terms of music and cuisine but what really disappointed us was the table we were allocated which was directly in front of the room entrance and 2m from it. It was a shocking location for a dinner and looked very much like an afterthought placement. We asked if we could be moved elsewhere, this request was completely ignored and it was only when we got up after waiting 10 minutes saying we refused to pay 100 Euros for such a table that we were hurriedly found an alternative. This point neatly summarises both the hotel's general lack of care towards guests and the less than stella service. I requested a front facing room a week in advance but despite this we were not allocated one. Now this may be because we were "only" a standard double but it was still a disappointment and our distinct impression was that rooms were simply allocated on arrival since we were briefly offered an alternative on check-in when it appeared our room was not ready and no mention of the preference was made. Compare this with the Majestic who allocated us a very nice front facing room that was ready 2 hours before "official" check-in time. A few further minor nggles, the bathroom was dated and showing its age including cracked electrical switches. I agree with a previous reviewer who mentioned that getting out of the over-bath shower was potentially dangerous as access was limited by the shower screen and marble bath top. There is very little hanging space in wardrobes and no drawers. The minibar was poorly stocked and fridge rusty/ unhygeinic. The internet TV is virtually unusable as it does not resize the page to the TV screen resolution. The TV did not show all channels - Sky News was frozen during our stay. The bed was 2 singles rather than a true double - common in many european hotels but again bettered by the Majestic. The slideout bedside table on one side was unusable being wobbly with broken handle. The room was generally small but the bathroom a good size. All these are small points but not conducive to a 5* experience. On the positive side? Well the hotel is in a good position for those wanting a nice area away from the major tourist haunts and walkable to both the the Gaudi Park and Sagrada. We walk a lot so found it central to all major sites including as far down as the port. The Gracia district behind / around the hotel has a much more "local" feel with some nice bars etc. Check out Verdi Street and nearby plazas for example. So in conclusion, a very disappointing stay where limited facilities and resources were further undermined by poor service. We are sad to say we would not recommend ths hotel and for our next stay in BCN will seek out an alternative 5*.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Will_HInverness
Reviews.Content: Booked through a cruise package this hotel was a real surprise and great start to our honeymoon. Very elegant and grand. Our room had the wow factor although I am not sure what grade of room it was. The puplic areas are very nice. Staff very friendly and attentive. On our arrival they could not do enough for us with maps and guides to the city. The whole hotel has a very relaxed feel to it. No milling crowds here. Breakfast was very good. We did not have dinner in the hotel so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic Escape”
Reviews.Author: fringegirl
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a five day stay in Barcelona. After reading the reviews about Hotel Casa Fuster I was convinced this was the perfect place to stay for my Husbands surprise 40th Birthday treat. We were not disappointed. This hotel is clean friendly and beautifully designed situated in a wonderful part of the City close but not too close to the touristy parts of Barcelona. Not to mention there are a variety of excellent tapas bars and restaurants all within walking distance. The metro and train stations are nearby for quick travel up and down the City. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. We were surprised to find a bottle of champagne and a selection of homemade chocolates in our room waiting when we arrived on my husbands birthday. This hotel is full of lovely touches and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone looking for a romantic getaway from it all. I must just mention the breakfast was one of the best I have ever seen .....the variety was immense and as it was included in our room rate it just added to the overall excellence of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modernista gem in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeTO
Reviews.Content: Our recent four-day stay at the Hotel Casa Fuster was a highlight of our trip to Barcelona. The hotel is beautiful both inside and out. We booked a junior suite at a promotional rate which included a comprehensive breakfast in their basement dining room. There is wired Internet available in the room, and also computers in the lobby area. The top-notch front service team were always available to answer questions and provide help. Our room key intermittently stopped working one day, and they fixed this within a few minutes. The 3rd floor room itself had a small balcony overlooking the Passeig de Gracia, as did the rooftop terrace. There were two LCD televisions, in the bedroom and the living area. Bathroom amenities included robes, slippers, and Loewe bath/cosmetic products. The separate shower stall was huge, although the whirlpool bathtub was a bit on the small side. We were celebrating my wife's birthday, and a nice bottle of cava and chocolates in our room one evening were a pleasant surprise. The location was quiet at night, and also excellent for shopping the February clearance sales. If you are a fan of Modernista architecture or are looking for a romantic stay in Barcelona, the Casa Fuster would be a solid bet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but some issues”
Reviews.Author: Serin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during several trips to Barcelona. The standard rooms tend to be cleaner and in a better state than the larger superior or deluxe rooms. The front desk staff is willing to assist at all times but their service is very slow. The hotel has an excellent location and it is very safe and pleasant to walk in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: eddielouie
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at this hotel in January 2009. Great location and hotel seemed empty which was nice. We arrived early in the morning and check-in was quick. Our suite (we booked a junior suite) was ready and were in the room shortly after arriving. Very nice room with two small flat TV's living room, bedroom and bathroom. Nicely appointed with two sinks ,big King bed, control panel on the beds for all lighting and balcony over looking Passieg De Gracia. Staff was very nice. We had a couple of problems which they fixed quickly. First I forgot my safe combo after I inserted it - there was a maintenance man there fast who fixed it. Second, the internet-on-tv, which had a fast connection, froze one day. We asked the hotel to fix while we were out - they didnt but when we got back someone did come up and fix it. My credit card didn't accept their hold charge so they allowed me to call US credit card company and problem got resolved in ten - fifteen minutes. We ate breakfast one day which was very nice but a little pricey considering options on the street (about $60 US for two of us). One minor quibble. They hang up bathrobes on a rack next to the shower which makes it difficult to close or open the shower doors - we had to move them each day to take a shower. All in all nothing significant to complain about although cannot comment on what its like in the high season.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mrsregino
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, very roomy and spacious accomodations, nice cuisine, morning buffet a little pricey but overall it is totally worth plus location is just the best. It has an amazing restaurant nearby, seafood, and very famous.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3Bergen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Fuster for 5 days and enjoyed it very much. Nicely located in the city at the end of the passeig de Gracia, the exterior of the hotel is very nice. Staff was helpfull, roof terrace was very nice, great views of the city. The room was wonderful, spacious, very nice bathroom, good beds. All in all very good, maybe only the prices in the bar could be a bit more sensible. But I guess that's part of the 5 star status*

Reviews.Title: “I agree - not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: TravellerNo2
Reviews.Content: I have rated this hotel 2 star only because it falls so short of the five star it claims. I stayed with my wife for one night prior to a cruise from the Port on a ship that WAS almost 5 stars the brilliance of the Seas. The Good: Concierge staff and reception, friedly and professional. The Building: Excellent and in a good location. The Room. Comfortable and well furnished. Public Areas: Well furnished if a little gloomy, due to 'atmospheric' lighting. The Problems: We retired early (10.30pm) after along day travelling to meet our cruise. We were woken by the dreaded mobile phone being used at full throttle by a memberof staff in the corridor outside our room. Resolved this by getting out of bed and remonstrating. We were next woken at about 3.am by revellers returning to the hotel. Repoteted this to reception 3 times before action was finally taken. Breakfast: is a joke for a 5 star hotel. It is now taken in the dining room and the 'hot' section is not kept hot, althogh the cold section has a decent variety. Another problem here is that the meal is taken on low (cabaret drink type) tables making for an uncomfotable experience. En suite: This is my main gripe, the bath/shower is now very old fashioned and looking very tired. I am sure that when it was first built it was at the edge etc. But now it is out of date, in my view a little dangerous to step out of the quite high sided bath after a shower requires more a lot more care than it should (I slipped, and my balance, weight posture is very good). Friendly professional staff are up to the job, there are now better quality and value hotels to be has in Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne_Delaney
Reviews.Content: This really was a great hotel. It's beautifully decorated, and the service was real 5 star service. Right from the moment we arrived we felt welcome. There was no stuffiness, the staff were very professional, and very friendly. The rooms were lovely, just the right size, and free internet connection in the room which was a bonus. Shower was excellent. Location was great too, we walked everywhere from here!

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: milehighflyboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the front end and tail end of a cruise. This is a beautiful hotel with unbelievable service - from their custom pillow menu to their bed turndown service. (note- do not use the do not disturb sign on the door if you want to take advantage turndown service , because they will not disturb you for any reason...PERIOD!! The room, although smaller than comparible American hotel rooms, was impecibly decorated and furnished. The room bar was fully furnished (but a tad expensive - even by European standards) We traveled with relatives but they didn't share the same experience (some construction jackhammering was occurring outside their room during the day) , but I'm sure the hotel would have changed their room if they would have complained to the hotel staff. All staff were fluent in english as well as other languages. The doorman even greeted us by name when we went out for dinner (amazing since we never gave him our names)! When we requested to have a 7:00am taxi night before we departed (which can be difficult in Barcelona as there is sometimes up to a two hour wait for Taxis), they had two of them right on time - waiting for us (about 30 Euros from the hotel to the airport and visa versa) This hotel, while not being on La Rambla, is in a perfect location. It is only a few hundred meters to many architectural landmarks - yet is not on a busy street. Walk out the doors and you can immediately shop for Gucci bags or Valentino dresses (Yea, right! - but it is nice to window shop - as they are truly beautiful garmets). is only a 20 minute romantic stroll along outdoor cafe's, bakeries, eateries and shops to reach La Rambla. The food from their resturant was fantastic, however the breakfast buffet was probably the best I have ever experienced. Imported cheeses, specialty hams, sausages, breads, coffees - even specialty diet foods (low fat preserves, crackers, cereals), etc., or you could just have a normal cooked to order meal such as an omlet. We had a most pleasant stay there and will definately stay there again when we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing building”
Reviews.Author: JCLON
Reviews.Content: Booked Casa Fuster via Expedia where they had a very good rate. I was concern they would give me a bad room as a result of the low rate but that was not the case at all. I had a nice corner room. The building is amazing and has been refurbished to very high standards. Breakfast is in a very nice room downstairs but is does not have windows so you may want to consider getting breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: SueTilley
Reviews.Content: Absolutely nothing but praise for this first class hotel. The location was perfect and having booked through What a Hotel found that we had the most amazing upgrade and lots of little touches that just make the difference between a good hotel and a luxury hotel. We ate in the main restuarant and the food was excellent. Nothing was too much trouble and the staff were exceptionally courteous and friendly. Having researched many of the hotels before we went, I am just so pleased that we picked Casa Fuster and would advise anyone else to do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tropo
Reviews.Content: The Halekulani on Waikiki is a five star hotel. The Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo is a five star hotel. Hotel Casa Fuster is not a five star hotel. There are three areas that make this hotel less comfortable than a Marriott. First, the design. We had a Junior Suite. There is a lttle extra room, but no curtain between the sitting area and the bed. I dragged a chair into the hallway to read while my husband was sleeping. Where do they expect you to put your clothes? There is no armoire. There are no dresser drawers. There is a very small closet that wasn't tall enough to hang even my shortest dress. It is filed with extra pilows and blankets and the totally uncomfortable hemp robes. I had a hanging bag that I attached to closet door, then had to stand on a chair to access. The rest of my clothes had to remain folded on top of a suitcase. They could have put a dresser where the totally unnecessary second television is jammed next to the bed. Exactly how were we supposed to watch the large and expensive main television? In front of the main television is a HUGE, heavy three foot round unmovable table. I stubbed my toe on it several times, but could not move it more than an inch or two. Others have mentioned the archaic keying system. There is only one key so my husband and I could not explore on our own without elaborate plans about who would be in the room and awake. That key is necessary to turn on the electricity. That means your room will be VERY warm when you return, since the air conditioning will be off the entire time you are gone, Don't expect any electrical outlets in the bathroom. I ended up curling my hair on my knees against the tall wall mirror in the bedroom. Yes, there is internet access in the room, but it took me three days to find the plug hidden behind the desk. And you better have taken your own ethernet cord. There are no instructions that access exists or how to use it in any of their literature. I spent an uncomfortable time using their reception area WiFi, because there are no sofas or tables in the lobby. just some beautiful wooden chairs. The second fault is the lack of maintenance. Three times we had to return to the front desk because our key failed to work in our door. The bathtub was a deep whirlpool tub, but the OFF switch and the volume adjustments did not work. You got a rather ineffectual splashing if the water was over two or three inches. Our room contained a permanently on lamp right near the bed. The only way to turn it off was to pull the plug. The room was so dark that you will need to get on your knees and plug in the lamp again when you are awake. The third fault is the unprepared concierge. We wanted to buy a Barcelona Card (free Metro and buses, discounts to museums) and even had a picture of it to show them. They tried to tell us where to buy a Bus Touristique card (a sad transportation system with lines an hour long even in October). They totally underestimated the time to walk to Sagrada Familia and the direction to take. They always seemed surprised that our key didn't work. They must know their system is flawed. I do want to say a few nice things about the hotel also. The bed and linens were very nice. The room was relatively quiet, if you didn't mind the children screaming in the playground next door during the day. The location was perfect for exploring the Eixample, the neighborhood with the most Gaudi buildings, and was very convenient to the Metro and several bus lines. And the best part was the hotel restaurant, Galaxo. We ate there because we were too tired to go elsewhere, but we should have gone there prepared for a feast. The food was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great personal service”
Reviews.Author: WanderingWicker
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in for years. Everything was spot-on from the moment we arrived at the front door. The servce was very personal and nothing was too much trouble during our three day stay. The rooms were very comfortable and the 'pillow menu' impressive. Im usually very critical of service and could not fault the hotel and its staff in any way. Before I booked I had read previous reviews and somone recommended usng 'whatahotel.com' . I found this US companys website exceptionally user-friendly. Their electronic communication was efficient considering we were arriving only 12 hours following the booking. We also saved over 50% on the room rate compared to other well know UK sites. Its not often you can say this these days but all in all a very good experience and we will be definately going back. Gents - you will certaintly score some serious 'brownie points' with this choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Place”
Reviews.Author: Atozz1
Reviews.Content: Casa Fuster is a great blend of old and new. Old being the Art Nouveau style of the 100 year old building and new being the electic modern style of the furnishings. The hotels and its staff are warm and welcoming. We booked using whatahotel and online website that provides special amenities to its partner hotels. Casa Fuster is in this virtuoso partner program and as a result the service provided was amazing. We were greated by the virtuoso staff at check-in and they made sure our stay was perfect - and that we received all of the special benes -- hotel room upgrade, wine/appetizer tasting with the hotel manager, free transport to the airport and breakfast each day. Plus they helped with all of our other details during our stay - including excellent restaurant recommendations/reservations. I travel a ton and do not believe I have every had such fantastic service. Love this hotel! I was travelling with my 8 year old daughter and we stayed for 4 nights. Barcelona is a super fun city - one of my favorties in the world. It truely has its own heart. The only disappointment for my daughter was the size of the rooftop pool. It is very small, but enough to cool off and the view from the rooftop is amazing! I told her it was better than not having one at all! This was still her favorite hotel too! We had a little balcony which had stone benches -- it was very tiny but enought to sit outside and enjoy the street view. Very charming! Considering we were on a busy street -- the hotel was super quiet. Our room had double doors, so we also didn't hear any noise from the hallway. The hotel is in a great location to walk to many of the sites including 2 of the major Gaudi buildings -- and the shopping!! Whew that exchange rate is brutal! Some people mentioned the dark basement restaurant that served breakfast....2 of the days they served breakfast upstairs and the last two it was down in the basement. Not ideal, but not bad and the food was excellent. I especially didn't care since my breakfast was included in my room rate. Definately not a deal breaker for me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cathy93
Reviews.Content: We treated ourselves to a short break in Barcelona. What a city! The Casa Fusta Hotel was a perfect choice for 2 nights. Slightly on the expensive side but a perfect treat. We loved the rooms, very comfortable furnishings, Jacuzzi in bathroom, great views over city from the balcony. The staff were great, perfect English which was a plus considering my Spanish is atrocious! You just couldn't beat the location. I would definitly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic break”
Reviews.Author: tlbaker
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise birthday present. Location is very good, just at the top of the high end shopping street (Gracia), and walking distance from many of Barcelona's main sights (Gaudi buildings, las rambla etc). The beach is a short taxi/bus ride away. Initial impressions were very good - amazing building, set just off a busy road so not too noisy. Bags were taken at the door by attentive staff. Check-in was very good and quick. We arrived at around 230 and were taken to our room straight away. Clerk also immediately gave us a map with the hotel on it and briefly explained it's proximity to local points of interest which was a nice touch. Room on the 5th floor was very nice with high class furnishings and large comfy bed - not huge in area, but then that doesn't really bother me. Beautiful views over La Familia and the city from the balcony. The bathroom was huge, with double sink and great whirlpool bath. Turndown/cleaning all done well and around our timing. Complementary water was nice, and bathroom kit was first rate. Also notable is the sound-proofing. There appeared to be a local festival one night, but we couldn't hear a thing! Downstairs bar is very pricing, but also very nice for (probably only one) drink. Concierge was also excellent, and recommended a very good restaurant in the mountains. Overall an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Charm”
Reviews.Author: JTres67
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here before a Mediterranean Cruise. The staff was very helpful and could speak English well. The hotel is kept very clean and the building and its’ décor are impeccable. Our bathroom was all marble – very clean. However, we did have a problem with water getting on the floor when we took a shower because of a lack of a shower door. You have to use your room key to turn on the power in your room on – great energy saving feature! We ate breakfast at their downstairs buffet – it was the best breakfast buffet – very classy and lots of choices no matter what you’re in the mood for. The king bed was two twins pushed together….it didn’t bother us – we just figured it was a European thing…not really sure. However, we found them quite comfortable. The only complaint besides the minor shower door issue was the price –we paid $600 US dollars for one night – it was nice but not sure if that price was justified…the room was quite small. As for the surrounding area…There is a nice little coffee shop just down the street we visited. They tell you are within 15 minutes walking distance to Sagrada Familia – however we found the walk to take more like 30 minutes…The hotel is about 3 or 4 blocks from one of Gaudi’s more famous buildings. I would defiantly stay here again if I could get it a little cheaper…

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhre else in BCN”
Reviews.Author: ThenHePackedAndLeft
Reviews.Content: I love Casa Fuster and the wonderful staff there. The only negative thing is the breakfast room. I am not too happy starting my day in a 'more suitable for a disco' -look space located in the basement with a staff consisting of lazy daydreamers and paying a lot for this 'fun'. Nevermind....there is a coffee shop with outdoor tables just across the entrance. There You can have a sunny start for your day. Special thanks for all the ground floor staff! Best service ever!

Reviews.Title: “Exudes class & superior service - but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: chitownguy1
Reviews.Content: Casa Fuster exudes class, style and superior service – but as with anything in life you get what you pay for. We stayed at the Casa Fuster for three nights April 25-April 28 2008. We had a bit of a lesson in supply and demand as the weekend we were there was the same as the F1 race in Barcelona and so room rates were higher across the entire city. And so it is….Anyway we are middle class folks but like to stay in quite nice hotels when we travel (and don’t mnd paying for it), but I think you’ll find some fairly practical comments relative to the hotel and its amenities. The hotel is optimally located at the top of Passeig de Gracia. One simply cannot beat the great shopping up and down Passeig de Gracia. It was a 5 minute walk to the Casa Mila, our first tourist stop one morning and a Bus Turistic stop as well. As someone else noted its about 10 mins give or take to Placa de Catalunya. There are some very nice restaurants within 2 minutes of Casa Fuster including Fernandez (where we dined one day for lunch) and El Toc de Gracia (where we dined for dinner – the hotel recommended the place). Cervesseria Cataluna was a 10 minute walk and a great dinner one evening as well. Hotel Majestic is in an even better location a bit further down Passeig de Gracia but I cant comment intelligently on that institution as we never set foot in there. We arrived at 1 PM on a Friday and were immediately checked-in. We had a reservation for a standard room and we were given Room 412 facing Passeig de Gracia with a decent view and a very small balcony. Because of the building’s historic landmark status, the rooms were not allowed to be expanded at all and thus space is definitely at a premium. In the standard room we had to move the chaise over a few feet just to open the balcony door, then slide our way through the balcony if we wanted to catch some fresh air. Having stated that its not as if the balcony is truly intended for spending significant amounts of time out there. We had to step around our suitcases just to get in and out of bed. If there is a next time we would definitely pay for a larger room. The bed was a true double and very comfortable, the pillows plush. There was a small desk and a flat screen TV just above the minibar. The closet was large enough and we managed just fine. The bathroom was very nicely done in marble and complete with bidet and his and her toiletries. We were religious about using the room safe and had absolutely no issues with any lost belongings or anything of the sort. As a matter of fact I will state that Casa Fuster provided an overwhelming feeling of safety relative to the Las Ramblas area etc. You could just feel you were in a better neighborhood and the staff acted accordingly. We tipped the maid one morning and noticed a difference in the level and timing of service (room cleaning and turn down) the next day – not sure if there is anything to that or not, just an observation. One gripe – the hotel claimed to have an iron (I checked before we left the US) in the room – not true. We arrived to find no iron in the hotel room (much to my fiance’s dismay!) and as with many luxurious European hotels, the hotel would not furnish one. Instead the hotel offered to press any item of clothing through its Laundry/Press service. The hotel charges 10 Euros to press one pair of pants, as an example. This is what one would expect for a high end hotel and so we do not mean to be talking out of both sides of our mouths – just thought there should be an iron when advertised as such. In retrospect it turns out that the Travelocity website noted the Casa Fuster provided an iron, not the hotel website itself. The rooftop terrace was very nice – we enjoyed a drink or two up there one pleasant afternoon and soaked up some 70 degree sun while admiring the view. As with most hotel pools in Barcelona – the rooftop pool did not impress at all – it is a tiny footpool by American standards. We then walked over and fell asleep for an hour or so in the lounge recliners on the roof. Very relaxing. If you are into exercising/working out, please don’t be too misled by Casa Fuster’s boasting of an exercise room. We are talking about one treadmill, one bike and a bench with no weights. Don’t get me wrong, the treadmill did its job just fine and there is a flatscreen TV in the small fitness room to boot. However there wasnt much equipment is all and had there been someone else wanting to exercise at the same time I wouldn’t have been altogether pleased. The sauna is a tiny room just off the exercise room. By far and away the most admirable trait of the Casa Fuster was its staff and service. The staff was absolutely fantastic, especially when compared to the Hotel 1898 (where we stayed for the next three nights). You leave your key when you depart the hotel (you should see the size of these things, remarkable :) and the staff will do their best to accommodate any request one has. The services provided to us ranged from: recommending casual, local restaurants as well as booking restaurant reservations at places like Arola et al, changing money at the front desk, providing information on local attractions such as Bus Turistic, Montsterrat, printing out the train schedules for us, booking a rental car, you name it really. On our last day there the staff held our luggage for 4 hours while we shopped and prior to our departure for Hotel 1898. Hailing a taxi was no problem through the equivalent of their bellboys and even the lowest ranking staff member truly seemed to be informed and happy to assist. I guess that is the point – many hotels offer such services but the folks here seemed to do it with a smile. Again I make these statements in comparison to the Hotel 1898, which was much more of a ‘we provide some info, you do the rest yourself” type of feeling. Would we stay again? We probably would. For the feeling of a fantastically constructed 5-star hotel and the service it provides. there is no mistaking the architecture and history. However, I would likely first explore other properties like Hotel Majestic or Claris (acknowledging Claris is a step below Fuster). In the end, no real complaints, we loved Casa Fuster.

Reviews.Title: “top class”
Reviews.Author: IrelandQwerty
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel very high quality rooms very professional staff a bit pricey but a nice treat. Location second to none. Very quiet this time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “casa fuster-another great barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommytraveller
Reviews.Content: Casa Fuster is a 5*GL hotel with prices to match. We did an air miles deal, so did not pay cash to stay. The hotel is 12 minutes walk from Plaza Catalunya, just north of the Diagonal-not totally central, but not too far either. The architecture and design is cool, Catalan and classy.Soem will say too dark, but we thought it atmospheric. The room was small but beautiful.The bathroom was remarkably large, but with no bidet and a shower along the side of the bath, it was not well thought through.The freebies were the best we have ever had in any hotel. Breakfast was superb, except the tea made with luke warm chlorinated water! Overall we had a great stay, but for the money, we would chose 1898 or Les Arts any day.

Reviews.Title: “Moderniste-treat!”
Reviews.Author: bfBoston
Reviews.Content: If you go to visit the Moderniste architectural movement in Barcelona, this hotel offers an opportunity to live in one of the fine examples of this architecture. This is an expensive place, and we were in what was called a standard room. The room itself was quite adequate in size and decor, and comparable to any standard room of a five star hotel; there was no significant view out of the back of the hotel. But the lobby area and other common space were first class, and I can only imagine what some of the expensive rooms looking out on the street might be like. The breakfast, served in the windowless basement, was unusual for its variety and quality, although the space was a bit strange. The people who worked at the hotel were warm and hospitable. The hotel is very centrally located, and is only several blocks from the Casa Mila--one of Gaudi's most famous buildings. And the Diagonal Metro station is only a block away, so access to the subway system is convenient. This is an upscale neighborhood, and we very much enjoyed our stay. I would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: jbruner
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, elegant, and sharp. Casa Fuster was incredible. I loved the decor of the rooms, although I found the beds a little less than average considering the caliber of the hotel. It was conveniently located close to a lot of the major sights of Barcelona. The staff was friendly and spoke english (my spanish is horrible). Overall I had a pleasant experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “top notch”
Reviews.Author: splodgey
Reviews.Content: What can I say that has'nt already been said about this gem of a hotel.My wife treated me to a short break at the CF for my birthday what a treat it was.From check-in to departure there was'nt a thing that could be faulted,exemplary service, spotless, helpfull and knowledgeable staff and all the thoughtfull little things like the upgraded room with a spectacular view towards Las Ramblas the fruit and chocolate platter hand piped with 'happy birthday'and the bottle of cava made our stay a very memorable one. We never paid any where near the rack rate for a room at this hotel which is what makes the treatment we received all the more special. All in all a truly memorable experience. Thank you to the staff and Management

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margouille
Reviews.Content: We booked the room in a Spanish discount site called www.atrapalo.es and got a great deal compared to the advertised rack rate, about half price if I remember well. The hotel is a bit away from the action. It didn't bother us as the walk was quite pleasant and it also meant that the area was quiet at night. Food can be found in the streets behind the hotel, Gracia neighbourhood. Very authentic with far fewer tourists than Las Ramblas or El Barrio Gotico. The building is gorgeous and not too far from 2 of Gaudi's most famous buildings. The rooftop bar and plunge pool are beautiful at sunset. Great place to relax with a drink after an afternoon about town. The rooms are nice, maybe a bit small for the price but quite modern and elegant. The bar close to reception is very nice with a modernista feel. They had jazz concerts when we were there. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this experience”
Reviews.Author: expatinespana
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, the location, the building, the rooms,the service. Top rate all the way. Expensive but worth every Euro cent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Pj
Reviews.Content: Great location a short walk from main attractions and shops. Casa Fuster is beautifully decorated and furnished in natural tones. Room quality is better than we would expect in major city hotels. However at nearly 300 Euros a night it is a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel, try it if you can.”
Reviews.Author: robphillips
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four night stay with my partner at this wonderful hotel. The location is good, at the top of the Passeig de Gracia about a 20 minute walk from the main hub at Catalunya Square - if you don't window shop at the exorbitant designer shops and stop at every bit of magnificent Gaudi architecture along the way. The hotel building is impressive inside and out and the attention to detail admirable. The high ceiling and cool ambience of reception, the amazing decor of the cafe bar with a view down Passeig de Gracia. The roof terrace has a similarly impressive viewpoint of the street and much of the rest of the city. The pool is small, but it would have been rude not to try it! We stayed in a Junior Suite, which was wonderful. I can't compare it to the other rooms, but the bed was huge and comfortable, the bathroom vast and well equipped and a nicely furnished lounge leading onto a small balcony, ideal for winding down after visiting the city. We ate one night in the restaurant and considering the quality of the food, the relaxing mood and pampering received, the price was not too bad, just over 100 Euros, three courses and a bottle of wine. No complaints from me. The service was excellent all the way through the hotel, from door man to reception, cleaners, bar staff etc everybody was friendly and extremely helpful. I couldn't have asked more. I struggle to think of any negatives. If pushed, we came back to the hotel at 10 one evening and ordered drinks for the roof terrace, but were told it was too late. A minor quibble, but the rest of the experience was pretty near perfect. A memorable expereince and a credit to everbody invloved with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: cfuller12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Casa Fuster in Barcelona for four nights in September 2007 and we're very pleased with the hotel. While not inexpensive, the quality of this hotel definitely lived up to the price. The rooms were typically European in that they weren't overly large, but were extremely well equipped with many amenities, large bathroom, etc. We also had a great experience with the hotel staff. They were extremely helpful in tracking down and retrieving a piece of lost luggage for us - we had an update every time we walked past the front desk without even asking - and they recommended several great restaurants in the area. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Leading Hotel not recommended for Leaders Club members (and those who are not)”
Reviews.Author: warum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Casa Fuster for one night on September 17th, 2007. As a Leaders Club Access member I booked a standard room via Leading Hotels (269,64 Euro tax included, without breakfast). At time of booking it was the most expensive Leading Hotel of all four Leading Hotels in Barcelona for that night. I arrived at 1.30pm. One doorman and two bellboys were on duty but talking with each other. I had to carry the luggage about 10m from the street to the hotel entrance on my own (at the entrance a bellboy asked for help). At reception there was no room available, so I did eat a club sandwich in the meantime. One hour later room 520 was ready, I got the key at reception but no guidance to the room. The room was one of the smallest I stayed for a long time, the last on the corridor at the backside of the hotel with no sights. According to the floor plan the room was one of the smallest on the fifth floor. Beside of the definetely not given room upgrade there was no welcome card, no welcome gift or fruits in the room, what is unusual for Leaders Club members. The key fob was very big and heavy (400g?) and one had to unlock the electricity system. with this key. Very annoying: the air condition stops working when you leave and you return into a heated room (32 degrees Celsius that day!). The in the directory mentioned remote controlled lighting wasn´t available and not necessary because you nearly could reache everything in the room without leaving the bed. There also were two small cupboard of maybe 40cm and a maximum length of one meter, no chance to hang trousers or to store a bit mor than three suits. The plastic hangers were fixed like in four star hotels. Beside two notepads there was no paper or envelopes available and any clock was missing, too (not even in the TV or telephone display). The bathroom was of good size, but without seperate shower stall what is unusual for newer Leading Hotels. When the bellboy with the luggage arrived I complained about the misssing clock (I don´t have one on my own and forgot my mobile phone), the small room and asked if there are no welcome amenities which are part of the Leaders Club programm. 20 minutes later a bottle of Cava with choclates was brought to the room (without any card but verv nice arranged) the clock was announced to be delivered. After five hours I asked for the clock. The new receptionist didn´t know about this request and told me that they could buy one for me by charging the costs to my room! Finally they delivered an alarm clock free of charge. Turn down was done correctly with a free bottle of mineral water, shoe shine wasn´t done overnight, a paper was not given in the morning either. A concierge is missing. All request have to be made at reception which makes you feel uncomfortable because other guests have to wait when they want to check in or to collect the room keys (due to the size and weight most guest leave the keys at reception). All in all not a dramatic stay but not what you normally expect when staying at a Leading Hotel (..."luxury sets them apart - Leading Hotels brings them together"). Everything but the rate was mediocre and cannot satisfy guests who often stay in upscaled properties - and pay 400 USD a year for a Leaders Club Access Membership with lots of promissed advantages. So I rate this hotel with two Tripadvisor-stars: "Okay, but some problems."

Reviews.Title: “classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: pips28
Reviews.Content: Classy hotel, in a classy part of barcelona, near to all the sights, a bit of a walk to las ramblas so a bit further away from the party scene. very helpful staff, rooms very tastefully decorated with nice bathrooms. turn down service and a pillow menu! some of the rooms do differ considerably in size though, maybe ask for a larger room,, also the rooftop pool is only really aplunge pool but the rooftop is lovley to sit out and have a few relaxing drinks. breakfast very expensive!
